DataElement.preferredName: Clinical And/Or Hematologic Recurrent Or Progressive Disease First Occurrence Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The month, day, and year of the first clinical and/or hematological recurrence or progression.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Clinical And/Or Hematologic Recurrent Or Progressive Disease First Occurrence
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity._Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid._Pertaining to or related to the blood and blood-forming organs._The return of a disease after a period of remission._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._Cancer that is increasing in scope or severity._Preceding all others in time or space or degree._An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Clinical And/Or Hematologic Recurrent Disease Or Progressive Disease First
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.:Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.:Pertaining to or related to the blood and blood-forming organs.:The return of a disease after a period of remission.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:Cancer that is increasing in scope or severity.:Preceding all others in time or space or degree.

Concepts.definition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.
Pertaining to or related to the blood and blood-forming organs.
The return of a disease after a period of remission.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.
Preceding all others in time or space or degree.

Property.preferredDefinition: Occurrence; an instance of something happening.

Concepts.definition: An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created new version associated to different CD and Display Format as part of NMDP Date VD clean up 4/2009. mcooper Corrected def from KM change. AK 3/25/19

ReferenceDocuments.name: What was the date of the firs
ReferenceDocuments.description: What was the date of the first clinical and/or hematological recurrence or progression?
